newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft, HP working on smart card standards.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft, HP working on smart card standards.

text.p: An international group of leading personal computer and "smart card" companies, including Hewlett-Packard Co and Microsoft Corp, Tuesday said they are working together to develop open standards that integrate smart cards with personal computers.

In a statement, the PC/SC Workgroup said the new technology will allow application developers to take advantage of the smart card's portability and hardware-based security, which are critical to enabling new smart-card-based PC applications for health care, banking, corporate security and electronic commerce.
The group, whose members have been working together since May 1996, said the technology is scheduled to be available to the industry during the fourth quarter of 1996.

Smart cards are used today for a variety of applications that range from portable, digital cash storage to proof of identity at universities. The new specifications announced by the PC/SC Workgroup will promote the development of new applications that tie the security and portability of smart cards with the worldwide installed base of personal computers.
